column4: Hey guys - has the Unity bug with dual screen monitors been fixed so I can have my right-side monitor as the main with Unity's bar on it?
altough to be honest  not that sure what bug your reffering to, but I guess since 11.04 is security updates only, no is the answer to your question
when you are running 2 monitors, you can't move the unity bar anywhere else EXCEPT on the far far left.
I want it on the left of my main screen (which is on the right)
I think that's something that won't be fixed untill maybe the next release, for what your reffering to
LOL. you gotta be kidding. Next release = fail if that's how long it will take.
well 11.04 is security updates only as far as I know, so don't expect any Unity fixes in it
I mean within a month or so would be nice to see the feature there... a feature that should have been there since day 1 if you ask me.
I can understand being limited on feature set, but at least keeping the potion for dual screeners out there... that just *makes sense*
well that's not how Ubuntu works, a release comes out, and useually only gets security updates after woulds
that sounds so fail. hate to sound negative but, that's really bad.

well Ubuntu isn't a rolling release like....  well there are people here who don't like other distro's being mentioned in here,  but one does come to mind, when it comes to getting security updates, but also proper later versions of programs when stable enough.
of course as far as I  know Unity is pretty much Ubuntu only at the moment though, because of certain technical reasons
well, I'm sure that has potential to change once ubuntu gets off of the guinea pig test-drive that they're currently doing with it.
no it will probably remain a versions distro, that only tends to get security updates, for well many years to come yet
I have no idea what you just said. I'm referring to Unity on other distros.

well  a guy from Fedora tried to do just that and even get it into the main repo's, and another guy tried to provide it for OpenSuse, but yep some technical issues.  Anyway this is going off topic now.
